info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 06 at 5:13PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A LAKE EFFECT SNOW BAND WILL AFFECT PARTS OF GENESEE...NIAGARA... AND NORTHERN ERIE COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A lake effect snow band which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile or less is dropping from the Northtowns of Buffalo back down to the City of Buffalo and out towards the airport. Snowfall rates will soon become 1 to 2 inches per hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 508 PM EST, a lake effect snow band is across the Buffalo Northtowns and slowly dropping southward. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lackawanna, Kenmore, Depew, Amherst, Tonawanda, Lancaster, Williamsville, Grand Island, Akron, Small Boat Harbor, Erie Basin Marina, Clarence Center, East Amherst and Rapids. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 53 and 49. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this lake effect snow band. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
